value: Road to Hungerford, just out of Thargomindah

is a town in south western

.  

Locally, the town is known as

.  Standing in Thargomindah it is easy to see the grand vision of Australia's pioneers.  Where every corner of the continent would be settled, and the outback areas would flourish with rich sheep properties.  Thargomindah is remote today, yet was planned as a grand town in the 1870's.
fly to Thargomindah twice weekly from

.

The town is accessible via sealed road from
.  The sealed section is one lane wide in places, meaning that you must pull one wheel off onto the gravel to pass oncoming traffic.  From
via well formed but unsealed road from

The town is fairly small, only a few blocks in each direction.  It is only 1km walk from the Airport to the centre of town. 

Cars seem to be allowed everywhere.  Only the main road is sealed, and the other roads are indicated by street signs, but often it isn't really clear where the road ends and when the dirt begins.

Needless to say there is no public transport in town.

value: name=Bulloo River & Cobb and Co Crossing
content=The new road bridge crosses the Bulloo the Eulo side of Thargo.  It is a short walk from the town centre.  The old Cobb and Co rock crossing crosses the river by the side of the road bridge.
The Bore at the Hydro Plant

content=Thargomindah was the site of the third hydroelectric generator in the world, after London and Paris.  See the French, British, and Australian flags flying over the Artesian Bore Gardens.  The plant is operated at 4PM daily.  At other times you can still see the bore and the machinery.

content=The town has three walks marked on the map you can pick up from the visitors information, the post office, or just about anywhere else in town.  The walk by the river is nice, and the walk out past the new town bore to the Artesian park is interesting.
content=Timber products and souvenirs "Bulloo Built" are available at the Post Office, Visitors Centre, and the pub
content=Supplies are available at the general store, and the fuel station.  Two fuel stations are available.
content=has a wide selection of fast food, sandwiches, ice-creams available all day, as well as supplies.  It has a inside and outside eating area.

There are a few accommodation choices in Thargo.  That said, if there is a local event, like a wedding, it is entirely possible for all the accommodation in town to be booked out.  Check with the place you are intending to stay, and they will tell you if there is going to be room without the need to make a confirmed booking.

value: content=Friendly staff basic but nice pub accommodation.
content=Recently renovated, the motel has 10 rooms, with double and single beds catering to singles, couples and families passing through or staying for work.

There are two payphones in town, one outside the Post Office.  The post office is open M-F, and Saturday mornings until 11AM.
If you keep going west, who knows where you might end up, the road just keeps going.  Back east, to
